title: What is the etymology of Saturn's name and how is it connected to agriculture and navigation?
first_phrase: In this text, the author provides an etymology of the Roman god Saturn. Earlier in the text, the author explains that Saturn taught agriculture and navigation to the people of Lazio. The last 200 tokens explore the etymology of Saturn's name, which the author explains was thought to derive from a root meaning "sower" or "cultivator." However, the author notes that this theory is no longer accepted and presents newer theories that interpret Saturn's name as related to creation and time, rather than agriculture.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the etymology of the name Saturn is still debated among experts, with several hypotheses suggesting different meanings. However, regardless of its origins, Saturn remains an important deity and symbol, with its influence extending in various fields, from agriculture to timekeeping, and even astronomy.
